Lecture 1a

Q1. A vector components can have what kind of data type?

Answer:

a. Same data type of all component

b. Only integer

c. Mix data type

d. Only character type

Q2. u <- c(2,3,4)

v <- c(3,4,5,6,7,8)

what is u +v?

Answer:

a. (5  7  9  6  7  8)

b. NaN

c. (5  7  9  8 10 12)

d. (3  4  5  8 10  12)

Q1. cbind() function combines _______ by columns?

Answer:

a. All of these

Lecture 2b

Q2 what kind of distribution is this:

x <- seq(0, 4, 0.1)

plot(x, dnorm(x, 2, 0.5), type = "l”)

Answer:

a. Normal

b. Poisson

c. Unified constant 

d. Binomial

Q1 m <- matrix(1:20, nrow=5,ncol=4)
How can the values be arranged in ascending order row wise?

Answer:

1 byrow = TRUE

2 bycol = TRUE
